citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: United States Core Based Statistical Areas, 2020

descript.abstract: U.S. Core-Based Statistical Areas represents geographic entities, defined by the United States Office of Management and Budget (OMB) for use by Federal statistical agencies, based on the concept of a core area containing a substantial population nucleus, together with adjacent communities having a high degree of social and economic integration with that core. A Core-Based Statistical Area (CBSA) consists of a U.S. county or counties or equivalent entities associated with at least one core (urban area or urban cluster) with a population of at least 10,000, plus adjacent counties having a high degree of social and economic integration with the core as measured through commuting ties with the counties containing the core. CBSAs are categorized as being either Metropolitan or Micropolitan. Each Metropolitan Statistical Area has at least one urban area that has a population of at least 50,000. Each Micropolitan Statistical Area has at least one urban area or urban cluster that has a population of at least 10,000, but less than 50,000.
descript.purpose: U.S. Core-Based Statistical Areas provides the boundaries and the names, types, and 2020 U.S. Census population information for the core-based statistical areas of the United States.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.datacred: U.S. Office of Management and Budget

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The spatial accuracy varies with the source materials used. The Census Bureau cannot specify the spatial accuracy of features changed or added by field staff or through local updates, features derived from the GBF/DIME Files (TIGER's predecessor in 1970 and 1980), or other map or digital sources. The positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: NOAA National Shoreline

pubinfo.publish: National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded Census TIGER/Line Geodatabases 2020 from the U.S. Census Bureau and extracted the counties dataset. Clipped to the shoreline using Census TIGER/Line Hydrography Geodatabases 2020 and NOAA National Shoreline datasets. Projected the dataset to World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84). Added the fields CBSA_ID, NAME, and CBSA_TYPE. Joined the fields from the U.S. Census Delineation Files - CBSAs Excel file and dissolved on the CBSA source field creating the CBSA polygons and getting the values for the CBSA_ID, NAME, and CBSA_TYPE fields. Added the field POPULATION (alias POPULATION_2020) from Esri and U.S. Census Bureau: 2020 (Public Law 94-171). Added the field SQMI and calculated its values projected to North America Albers Equal Area Conic. Added and calculated the field POP_SQMI (alias POP20_SQMI). Reordered, renamed, and removed fields.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the core-based statistical areas of the United States. A Core-Based Statistical Area (CBSA) consists of a U.S. county or counties or equivalent entities associated with at least one core (urban area or urban cluster) with a population of at least 10,000, plus adjacent counties having a high degree of social and economic integration with the core as measured through commuting ties with the counties containing the core. CBSAs are categorized as being either Metropolitan or Micropolitan. Each Metropolitan Statistical Area has at least one urban area that has a population of at least 50,000. Each Micropolitan Statistical Area has at least one urban area or urban cluster that has a population of at least 10,000, but less than 50,000.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
